intro: Myoxanthus hirtipes, commonly known as the hairy myoxanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers with prominent stamens, typical of the Malvaceae family. Myoxanthus hirtipes is often found in wetlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
